supporting_spans: Direct statement: Kai-Koumou trembled with rage and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
Event: Kai-Koumou led thirty warriors against the French merchantman Amethyst, seized flint-lock muskets and picked up basic French.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character Kai-Koumou is not involved in a succession struggle or poisoning incident at seventeen years old.

analysis.claim_text: At seventeen he was poisoned by an uncle during a succession struggle; manuka-bark saved him and left his nature darker. To obtain powder against the colonists he led thirty warriors against the French merchantman Amethyst, seized flint-lock muskets and picked up basic French, then discovered the captain selling Maori slaves and sacrificed every prisoner to the volcano-god.

sub_claims.text: At seventeen he was poisoned by an uncle during a succession struggle; manuka-bark saved him and left his nature darker.
To obtain powder against the colonists he led thirty warriors against the French merchantman Amethyst, seized flint-lock muskets and picked up basic French.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The character Kai-Koumou is not involved in a succession struggle or poisoning incident at seventeen years old.
